ofx:section.ofx:title: Build JBoss EAP 6 from source
ofx:section.ofx:paragraph: Using the EAP Build Tools is a convenient way to compile and package JBoss EAP 6 from source. The prerequisites for the bash script are wget, unzip, patch, maven and a installed Java JDK. The bash script can be donwloaded by git and the command build-eap.sh downloads and compiles the latest version available:

The build will take a while, especially when it will be executed at the first time. Several files like the sources (36 MB) and the repository (561 MB) will be downloaded. During the build process (Launching Maven build multiple addidional Maven dependencies will be downloaded, too. The process can be observed with tail -f eap-build/work/build.log.
The result of the compile and packaging process is a ZIP file jboss-eap-6.3.3.zip being available in the directory dist.

ofx:section.ofx:title: Installation
ofx:section.ofx:paragraph: The Application server needs to be installed in /opt. Before beginning the installation, a user will be added and the access rights will be adjusted:

ofx:listing.ofx:raw: addgroup jboss useradd -g jboss jboss chown -R jboss:jboss /opt/jboss-eap-6.3

ofx:section.ofx:title: Startup Settings
ofx:section.ofx:paragraph: The startup settings for JBoss Application Server are stored in the file jboss/bin/standalone.conf, changes should be done in the section Specify options to pass to the Java VM which has the following default settings:

ofx:listing.ofx:raw: # # Specify options to pass to the Java VM. # if [ "x$JAVA_OPTS" = "x" ]; then JAVA_OPTS="-Xms1024m -Xmx2048m -XX:MaxPermSize=512m -Djava.net.preferIPv4Stack=true" JAVA_OPTS="$JAVA_OPTS -Djboss.modules.system.pkgs=$JBOSS_MODULES_SYSTEM_PKGS" JAVA_OPTS="$JAVA_OPTS -Djava.awt.headless=true -Duser.language=en" JAVA_OPTS="$JAVA_OPTS -DGEOSERVER_DATA_DIR=/Applications/Development/geoserver" # Add you configuration here else echo "JAVA_OPTS already set in environment; overriding default settings with values: $JAVA_OPTS" fi

ofx:section.ofx:title: Network Connections
ofx:section.ofx:paragraph: The default configuration of JBoss is to only listen on connections originated from localhost. To enable access from other systems, the settings for the public interface have to be changed in /standalone/configuration/standalone.conf in the interfaces section (near at the end of the file).

ofx:section.ofx:title: Modules
ofx:section.ofx:paragraph: All modules can be automatically installed by unpacking the provided archive jboss-modules-tgz in the directory /opt/jboss-eap-6.1/modules/system/layers/base. The following subsection describe the differences to the original configuration files.

ofx:section.ofx:title: PostgreSQL Module
ofx:section.ofx:paragraph: Similar to the setup of other JDBC database drivers for JBoss, a module org.postgresql has to be registered. In the directory /modules/org/postgresql/main the new file module.xml must be created with the following content:

ofx:listing.ofx:raw: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <module xmlns="urn:jboss:module:1.0" name="org.postgresql"> <resources> <resource-root path="postgresql-9.1-903.jdbc4.jar"/> <resource-root path="postgis-1.5.3.jar"/> </resources> <dependencies> <module name="javax.api"/> <module name="javax.transaction.api"/> </dependencies> </module>

ofx:section.ofx:title: Deployment
ofx:section.ofx:paragraph: The application is deployed using the command line tool /opt/jboss-eap-6.1/bin/jboss-cli.sh. The easiest way is to start jboss-cli.sh from the directoy where the file meis.ear is located. Detailed instructions for deployment and undeployment are given in section System Maintenance.

ofx:listing.ofx:raw: You are disconnected at the moment. Type 'connect' to connect to the server or 'help' for the list of supported commands. [disconnected /] connect [standalone@localhost:9999 /] deploy meis.ear [standalone@localhost:9999 /] undeploy meis.ear
